1→import type { CSPNonce } from './csp';
     2→
     3→/**
     4→ * Content Security Policy directives configuration
     5→ *
     6→ * CSP helps prevent XSS attacks by controlling which resources can be loaded
     7→ * and executed on the page. The nonce-based approach allows specific inline
     8→ * scripts while blocking all others.
     9→ */
    10→interface CSPDirectives {
    11→  'default-src': string[];
    12→  'script-src': string[];
    13→  'style-src': string[];
    14→  'img-src': string[];
    15→  'font-src': string[];
    16→  'connect-src': string[];
    17→  'frame-ancestors': string[];
    18→  'base-uri': string[];
    19→  'form-action': string[];
    20→  'object-src': string[];
    21→}
    22→
    23→/**
    24→ * Security headers configuration
    25→ */
    26→export interface SecurityHeaders {
    27→  'Content-Security-Policy': string;
    28→  'X-Frame-Options': string;
    29→  'X-Content-Type-Options': string;
    30→  'Referrer-Policy': string;
    31→  'Permissions-Policy': string;
    32→  'Strict-Transport-Security': string;
    33→}
    34→
    35→/**
    36→ * CSP directives template with nonce placeholder
    37→ *
    38→ * The {{NONCE}} placeholder will be replaced with an actual nonce value
    39→ * by the middleware on each request.
    40→ */
    41→const cspDirectives: CSPDirectives = {
    42→  // Default policy - restrict to same origin
    43→  'default-src': ["'self'"],
    44→
    45→  // Script sources - allow self, Google Analytics, and nonce-based inline scripts
    46→  'script-src': [
    47→    "'self'",
    48→    'https://www.googletagmanager.com',
    49→    'https://www.google-analytics.com',
    50→    "'nonce-{{NONCE}}'", // Placeholder for dynamic nonce
    51→  ],
    52→
    53→  // Style sources - allow self, inline styles (for Tailwind), and Google Fonts
    54→  // Note: 'unsafe-inline' is needed for Tailwind's runtime style injection
    55→  'style-src': [
    56→    "'self'",
    57→    "'unsafe-inline'",
    58→    'https://fonts.googleapis.com',
    59→  ],
    60→
    61→  // Image sources - allow self, data URIs, and Google Analytics
    62→  'img-src': [
    63→    "'self'",
    64→    'data:',
    65→    'https://www.google-analytics.com',
    66→    'https://www.googletagmanager.com',
    67→  ],
    68→
    69→  // Font sources - allow self and Google Fonts
    70→  'font-src': [
    71→    "'self'",
    72→    'https://fonts.gstatic.com',
    73→  ],
    74→
    75→  // Connection sources - allow self and Google Analytics
    76→  'connect-src': [
    77→    "'self'",
    78→    'https://www.google-analytics.com',
    79→    'https://www.googletagmanager.com',
    80→  ],
    81→
    82→  // Frame ancestors - prevent embedding in iframes (clickjacking protection)
    83→  'frame-ancestors': ["'none'"],
    84→
    85→  // Base URI - restrict base tag to same origin
    86→  'base-uri': ["'self'"],
    87→
    88→  // Form actions - restrict form submissions to same origin
    89→  'form-action': ["'self'"],
    90→
    91→  // Object sources - block plugins like Flash
    92→  'object-src': ["'none'"],
    93→};
    94→
    95→/**
    96→ * Converts CSP directives object to a CSP header string
    97→ *
    98→ * @param nonce - Optional nonce value to replace the {{NONCE}} placeholder
    99→ * @returns CSP header value as a string
   100→ */
   101→export function buildCSPHeader(nonce?: CSPNonce): string {
   102→  const directives = Object.entries(cspDirectives)
   103→    .map(([key, values]) => {
   104→      const valueString = values.join(' ');
   105→      // Replace nonce placeholder if nonce is provided
   106→      const processedValue = nonce
   107→        ? valueString.replace('{{NONCE}}', nonce)
   108→        : valueString.replace("'nonce-{{NONCE}}'", ''); // Remove nonce directive if no nonce
   109→      return `${key} ${processedValue}`;
   110→    })
   111→    .join('; ');
   112→
   113→  return directives;
   114→}
   115→
   116→/**
   117→ * Other security headers (non-CSP)
   118→ *
   119→ * These headers provide additional security layers:
   120→ * - X-Frame-Options: Prevents clickjacking by blocking iframe embedding
   121→ * - X-Content-Type-Options: Prevents MIME type sniffing
   122→ * - Referrer-Policy: Controls referrer information sent with requests
   123→ * - Permissions-Policy: Controls browser features and APIs
   124→ * - Strict-Transport-Security: Forces HTTPS connections
   125→ */
   126→const otherSecurityHeaders = {
   127→  // Prevent the page from being embedded in iframes
   128→  'X-Frame-Options': 'DENY',
   129→
   130→  // Prevent browsers from MIME-sniffing responses
   131→  'X-Content-Type-Options': 'nosniff',
   132→
   133→  // Control referrer information - send origin on cross-origin requests
   134→  'Referrer-Policy': 'strict-origin-when-cross-origin',
   135→
   136→  // Disable potentially dangerous browser features
   137→  'Permissions-Policy': 'camera=(), microphone=(), geolocation=()',
   138→
   139→  // Force HTTPS for 2 years, including all subdomains
   140→  // Note: Only applied in production (middleware should check environment)
   141→  'Strict-Transport-Security': 'max-age=63072000; includeSubDomains; preload',
   142→};
   143→
   144→/**
   145→ * Builds complete set of security headers with CSP nonce
   146→ *
   147→ * @param nonce - CSP nonce value for inline scripts
   148→ * @returns Object containing all security headers
   149→ */
   150→export function buildSecurityHeaders(nonce: CSPNonce): SecurityHeaders {
   151→  return {
   152→    'Content-Security-Policy': buildCSPHeader(nonce),
   153→    ...otherSecurityHeaders,
   154→  };
   155→}
   156→
   157→/**
   158→ * Builds security headers for static routes (without nonce)
   159→ *
   160→ * This is used for routes that don't need inline scripts, such as
   161→ * static assets, API routes, etc.
   162→ *
   163→ * @returns Object containing all security headers without nonce-based CSP
   164→ */
   165→export function buildStaticSecurityHeaders(): Omit<SecurityHeaders, 'Strict-Transport-Security'> {
   166→  return {
   167→    'Content-Security-Policy': buildCSPHeader(),
   168→    'X-Frame-Options': otherSecurityHeaders['X-Frame-Options'],
   169→    'X-Content-Type-Options': otherSecurityHeaders['X-Content-Type-Options'],
   170→    'Referrer-Policy': otherSecurityHeaders['Referrer-Policy'],
   171→    'Permissions-Policy': otherSecurityHeaders['Permissions-Policy'],
   172→  };
   173→}
   174→
   175→/**
   176→ * Export CSP directives for inspection/testing
   177→ */
   178→export { cspDirectives };

     6→ * Next.js Middleware for Security Headers
     7→ *
     8→ * This middleware injects security headers into all responses, including:
     9→ * - Content Security Policy (CSP) with dynamic nonce generation
    10→ * - X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, Referrer-Policy
    11→ * - Permissions-Policy, Strict-Transport-Security
    12→ *
    13→ * The CSP nonce is generated uniquely per request and stored in request
    14→ * headers so server components can access it via headers().get('x-nonce').
    15→ */
    16→export function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
    17→  // Generate a unique nonce for this request
    18→  const nonce = generateNonce();
    19→
    20→  // Build security headers with the nonce
    21→  const securityHeaders = buildSecurityHeaders(nonce);
    22→
    23→  // Create response with security headers
    24→  const response = NextResponse.next();
    25→
    26→  // Apply all security headers to the response
    27→  Object.entries(securityHeaders).forEach(([key, value]) => {
    28→    response.headers.set(key, value);
    29→  });
    30→
    31→  // Store the nonce in request headers so server components can access it
    32→  // Server components can retrieve this using: headers().get('x-nonce')
    33→  response.headers.set('x-nonce', nonce);

     5→/**
     6→ * Next.js Middleware for Security Headers
     7→ *
     8→ * This middleware injects security headers into all responses, including:
     9→ * - Content Security Policy (CSP) with dynamic nonce generation
    10→ * - X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, Referrer-Policy
    11→ * - Permissions-Policy, Strict-Transport-Security
    12→ *
    13→ * The CSP nonce is generated uniquely per request and stored in request
    14→ * headers so server components can access it via headers().get('x-nonce').
    15→ */
    16→export function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
    17→  // Generate a unique nonce for this request
    18→  const nonce = generateNonce();
    19→
    20→  // Build security headers with the nonce
    21→  const securityHeaders = buildSecurityHeaders(nonce);
    22→
    23→  // Create response with security headers
    24→  const response = NextResponse.next();
    25→
    26→  // Apply all security headers to the response
    27→  Object.entries(securityHeaders).forEach(([key, value]) => {
    28→    response.headers.set(key, value);
    29→  });
    30→
    31→  // Store the nonce in request headers so server components can access it
    32→  // Server components can retrieve this using: headers().get('x-nonce')
    33→  response.headers.set('x-nonce', nonce);
